question:
Which of the following statements are correct?
A. Diaphragm contracts during inhalation.
B. Oxygen is transported mainly by white blood cells.
C. Left lung is smaller than the right lung.

Which of the following statements are correct?
A. Alveoli are the site of gas exchange.
B. Trachea is also called the food pipe.
C. Haemoglobin carries oxygen in the blood.

Which of the following are correct?
A. Anaerobic respiration occurs in absence of oxygen.
B. Exhalation involves diaphragm contraction.
C. Bronchi lead into bronchioles.

Which statements are true?
A. Voice is produced in the larynx.
B. Carbon dioxide is transported as bicarbonate ions.
C. Yawning increases oxygen saturation in the blood.

Identify the correct statements.
A. Oxygen diffuses into blood at alveoli.
B. CO₂ diffuses into alveoli from blood.
C. Trachea connects pharynx to stomach.

Choose the correct statements.
A. Breathing rate increases during physical activity.
B. Exhalation is always an active process.
C. Haemoglobin is found in red blood cells.

Which of the following are correct?
A. Tracheal respiration is found in insects.
B. Cutaneous respiration is found in fish.
C. Pulmonary respiration occurs in mammals.

Select the correct combination.
A. Bagassosis – Cane dust
B. Anthracosis – Cotton dust
C. Silicosis – Stone dust

Which statements are correct?
A. Respiration takes place in every living cell.
B. Breathing is a part of respiration.
C. Respiration and breathing are exactly the same.

Which of the following statements are correct?
A. During inhalation, chest cavity expands.
B. During exhalation, diaphragm relaxes.
C. Oxygen is exhaled out from the body.
